title: George Kingsley Acquah
text:
Justice George Kingsley Acquah (4 March 1942 – 25 March 2007) was the twenty-third (23rd ) <a href="Chief%20Justice">Chief Justice</a> of the <a href="Supreme%20Court%20of%20Ghana">Supreme Court of Ghana</a>(the eleventh since independence). He was appointed as Chief Justice on 4 July 2003 and was the incumbent until his death.
Early life.
Justice Acquah was born on 4 March 1942 at <a href="Sekondi">Sekondi</a> in the <a href="Western%20Region%20%28Ghana%29">Western Region</a> of <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>. He had his basic education in a number of schools, namely Half Assini Methodist School, Cape Coast Methodist School, Ashanti Bekwai Methodist School, Akim Oda Methodist School, Nkawkaw Methodist School and Dunkwa-on-Offin Anglican School. He attended <a href="Adisadel%20College">Adisadel College</a> at <a href="Cape%20Coast">Cape Coast</a>, from 1957 to 1963 for his secondary and sixth form (college) education. He was an undergraduate at the <a href="University%20of%20Ghana">University of Ghana</a>, <a href="Legon">Legon</a> between 1964 and 1967 and obtained a B.A (Hons) degree in Philosophy. In 1970, he obtained the LL.B. (Hons) degree in law from the same university. He then attended the Ghana Law School where he obtained his Professional Certificate in Law and was called to the Bar in 1972.
Working life.
Justice George Acquah was in private legal practice at <a href="Cape%20Coast">Cape Coast</a> from 1972 until 19 September 1989 when he became a <a href="High%20Court%20judge%20%28England%20and%20Wales%29">High Court Judge</a>, working at <a href="Ho%2C%20Ghana">Ho</a> in the <a href="Volta%20Region">Volta Region</a>. He rose to become an <a href="Appellate%20court">Appeal Court</a> Judge in June 1994 and then a Supreme Court Judge a year later.
Death.
Justice Acquah died of cancer on 25 March 2007, aged 65, in <a href="Accra">Accra</a>. He was married with six children.
